sections.text:
### Simple Mode Defaults (Backend/State) — Feature Design

We will introduce a “Simple Mode” onboarding path that applies a minimal, recommended default configuration on first run to reduce setup complexity for small teams. Simple Mode will preselect a curated set of alerts, templates, and models and auto-enable only the core **Sales_Accelerator** workflows: **forecasting**, **next-best-action**, and **risk alerts**. Users can later switch to “Advanced” mode to unlock the full configuration surface, but this ticket focuses on backend defaults and state management (UI/progressive disclosure is out of scope).

On first run, the system will determine an onboarding “mode” and apply a corresponding **default config bundle**. For Simple Mode, the bundle will (1) enable the three core workflows, (2) bind workflow inputs to **Customer_Analyzer** fit/positioning outputs as the primary signals, and (3) select a small set of recommended alert types and message templates with safe thresholds that do not require manual tuning. The bundle will be versioned (e.g., `simple_v1`) to allow iteration over time, and persisted as an applied “baseline” so we can distinguish user customizations from defaults.

State management will include a durable `onboardingMode` (Simple/Advanced), an `appliedDefaultBundleVersion`, and per-feature enablement flags stored in the customer/org configuration store. The first-run initializer will be idempotent: if any of these fields are already set (or if the org has existing config/customizations), it will not overwrite them. Switching to Advanced later will update only the mode flag and unlock additional capabilities without disabling the already-enabled core workflows; reverting to Simple (if supported) should avoid destructive changes and at most reapply missing Simple defaults, never removing user-enabled advanced features.

Implementation will add a backend “default config applier” that assembles the Simple bundle, writes config + flags in a single transaction, and records an audit event for traceability. We will expose a minimal internal API for reading/writing the onboarding mode and for retrieving the resolved defaults (for future UI tickets). Key success criteria: new orgs start with working core workflows using Customer_Analyzer inputs, require zero manual tuning to generate initial outputs/alerts, and no existing org configuration is clobbered by the initializer.
